brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the combined training effectiveness of
      mechanical robot and neuromuscular electrical stimulation on upper limb rehabilitation after
      stroke.

clinical_study.brief_title: Upper Limb Rehabilitation After Stroke Assisted With a Hybrid Electrical Stimulation (ES)-Robot System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        The recruited subjects will

          -  have unilateral ischemic brain injury or intracerebral hemorrhage at least 6 months
             after the onset of single stroke

          -  have moderate level of motor impairment in the affected upper limb, assessed by
             Fugl-Meyer Assessment (9<shoulder/elbow<27; 6<wrist/hand<18)

          -  have enough cognition to be able to follow the training protocol as assessed by
             Mini-metal State Examination (MMSE>21)

          -  have detectable EMG signals (3 times of the standard deviation above the baseline)
             from the upper limb muscles.

intervention.description: The recruited subjects will receive 20-session device assisted upper limb training with an intensity of 3 to 5 sessions/week, which will be finished within 7 consecutive weeks. In each session, the subjects will conduct the system assisted and task-oriented upper limb training for 1.5 hours.

clinical_study.official_title: Biomechatronic System Using Electromyography (EMG)-Driven Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation (NMES) for Upper Limb Rehabilitation

oversight_info.authority: Hong Kong: Joint CUHK-NTEC Clinical Research Ethics Committee

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Fugl-Meyer Assessment Scale after training
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) up to 7 weeks, 2) 3 months after participants finish the training

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
